Full Job Description
POSITION OVERVIEW:
IT DESKTOP SUPPORT

Mass Markets is a rapidly growing, industry leading business process outsourcing and software development organization. As a high growth organization with an entrepreneurial culture we are committed to a high octane, fun and collaborative work environment. As a member of the Mass Markets team you will have a high degree of responsibility and autonomy giving you a singular opportunity to make a difference is the organizations shape, direction and growth.

  • :
POSITION RESPONSIBILITIES:
WHAT DOES AN IT DESKTOP SUPPORT DO?

This position provides basic technical onsite and remote support including diagnosis of user problems related to specific supported hardware, software, and networking services provided by the IT department. Reporting directly to the director of network engineering, this position serves as the first point of contact troubleshooting, technology training, and new technology needs and facilitates the next level of support personnel for issues he/she cannot individually resolve.

Problem recognition, research, isolation, resolution, and follow-up for all computers and software within the organization.
Install and configure new hardware, maintain existing hardware, and track hardware inventory in real-time.
Operating system and software installation and configuration and maintain an accurate software license tracking system in real-time.
Asset management - responsible for tracking desktop hardware and software inventory in real-time.
On-site support - participate in end-user support and problem management for all areas of the IT infrastructure.
Coordinate with supervisors to provide high-quality support for new systems, projects and upgrades.
Other duties as assigned.

CANDIDATE QUALIFICATIONS:
WONDER IF YOU ARE A GOOD FIT?

Qualified candidates will be willing to learn new programs, processes and technology. Candidates should be positive, driven and confident individuals that will represent the company and its customers professionally at all times. Experience in customer care, sales or contact center role is a plus. To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. The primary requirements of this position include but are not limited to the following:

Desktop Support or IT Help Desk experience
Proficiency researching and troubleshooting complex problems and errors
Demonstrated ability with basic networking, and telephony
Demonstrated ability to research, plan, document, and execute complex tasks/projects
Excellent written and oral communication skills
Excellent interpersonal and customer service skills
Excellent work ethic and dedication
Associate’s (or equivalent) degree in Computer Science or Information Technology from a technical school OR equivalent combination of education and experience
CompTIA (A+, Network +, Server+ and Security+ certifications and/or Microsoft Certified IT Professional (MCITP) are a plus but not required

COMPENSATION DETAILS:
WANT AN EMPLOYER THAT VALUES YOUR CONTRIBUTION?

We believe that hard work should pay off, so we make sure that our compensation and total rewards are competitive. Standard starting compensation is commensurate with experience. Regular reviews and raises are awarded based on tenure and performance, so our employees make more each year.

Employees earn paid time off as well as paid holidays and paid training opportunities. Regular daily, weekly and monthly incentives are part of the overall compensation our team members enjoy and include monetary incentive and prizes such as computers, tablets, phones, TV’s, trips, tickets, and even cars. In addition to our standard group benefits offering for full-time employees following 90-days of employment, all employees are eligible to opt for our MEC medical plan after only 30-days of employment. Benefits options and plans vary slightly by location.

JUST A FEW OF THE BENEFITS

Medical, Dental, and Vision Coverage Options
Paid Time-Off
Regular Raises
Work-at-Home Opportunities
Advancement Opportunity
Fun, Engaging Work Environment
Casual Dress Code
Cash and Prize Contests

SCHEDULE:
NEED A SCHEDULE THAT WORKS WITH YOUR LIFE?

We can offer a wide range of scheduling options for qualified candidates. There are multiple shifts and weekly work variations available to our team members. Please ask a Talent Acquisition Specialist about the different types of creative scheduling options that are available at your location. Whether you are a busy parent, student, or just want control of your work-life balance, flexible, customized scheduling is one of the perks of working at our organization.

PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS:
This job operates in a professional office environment. While performing the duties of this job, the employee will be largely sedentary and will be required to sit/stand for long periods while using a computer and telephone headset. The employee will be regularly required to operate a computer and other office equipment, including a phone, copier, and printer. The employee may occasionally be required to move about the office to accomplish tasks; reach in any direction; raise or lower objects, move objects from place to place, hold onto objects, and move or exert force up to forty (40) pounds.

CONDITIONS OF EMPLOYMENT:

In 2019 Marlowe Companies Inc. (MCI) was named by Inc. description:
Full Job Description
My name is Tony Bruno from Career Developers, and it's been awhile since we have reached out to you from our firm, but wanted to inform you about exciting positions we have for a growing client.

They are a Financial Services company in NY, NY looking for a Full Time Network Operations Engineer Employee (1) and a Team Lead Service Desk Employee (1). Understanding of Financial Markets (Equity, Futures, Options, etc). Also produce and review Key Performance Indicators (KPI's).

Tony Bruno – Sr. Staffing Specialist
201-962-3563 (Direct)
tonybruno@careerdevelopers.com

Job #1-Network Operations Engineer
**NO C2C or Visas-Full-Time/Perm Job. **NO Interns/Trainees Please.

Client Profile:
Our XXX company fuels the Global Capital Markets community through the provision of trading technology and analytics solutions. As financial industry experts at the center of markets and technology, we help our clients efficiently scale their business and quickly access markets, supporting them through the full trading lifecycle. We are a Global Company headquartered in New York, with nine offices across the globe.

Purpose of the Role:
The Network Operations Team is responsible for maintaining the operational stability of all aspects of the Client's XXX proprietary electronic trading network, The Client XXX is a cutting edge, multi-vendor, multi-technology network that spans over forty locations globally.

Network Operations provide critical front-line support across many of the Client's XXX infrastructure technology domains, including, but not limited to:

Global and Regional WAN connectivity.
Metro Area Dark Fibre networks.
Ultra Low Latency Trading Fabric.
Edge connectivity to 200+ Financial Markets.
Data Center LAN networks in 40+ locations.
Market Data Feeds.
Bespoke client Trading environments.

Network Operations are a Global Team consisting of regional teams located in London, New York, Singapore, and Tokyo. The team operates a follow-the-sun model that provides dedicated network support 24 hours a day, 365 days a year.

This is a client facing role that demands a high standard of customer service and technical support be provided to both our internal and external clients.
Alongside normal daily activities, the role provides the opportunity to participate in project-based initiatives and collaboration with other technology teams.

Responsibilities and duties (include but are not limited to):
  • Diagnose the root cause of operational issues and provide suitable technical solutions for effective resolution.
  • Perform triage, troubleshooting, and fault resolution as part of Client's XXX Incident Management process.
  • Monitor the operational health of the network infrastructure using Event Management Systems and analysis tools.
  • Prepare and implement network changes in accordance with Client's XXX Change Management policy.
  • Work directly with clients to assist with support queries in alignment with Service Level Agreements, SLAs.
  • Identify opportunities within the environment to reduce inefficiencies, increase
operational stability, and enhance security.
  • Create and maintain technical documentation, including: infrastructure diagrams,
procedural run books, and knowledge base pages.
  • Adopt the use of the DevOps tool set to efficiently complete discovery and implementation tasks.
  • Manage client and internal case queues for all incident and project-based work.
  • Participate in Global Team collaboration efforts, including: shift handover, technical peer reviews, and knowledge transfers.
Education, Skills, and Background (including experience requirements):
  • 3 – 5 years of experience working in a large Enterprise or Service Provider environment.
  • Certified to CCNP level, or equivalent level of knowledge and experience.
  • Clear written and verbal communication skills.
  • Ability to prioritize and manage own workload.
  • Experience working within the Financial Industry Highly Preferred.
Required Skills:
  • Solid understanding of IPv4 addressing with the ability to subnet using VLSM.
  • Demonstrable understanding and experience supporting the following: o 802.1q VLANs and Trunks.
Multiple Spanning Tree Protocol.
o Etherchannel o Static Routing .
o OSPFv2 o BGPv4
o Routing protocol redistribution o Network Traffic Engineering using routing policies o Access Control Lists o Network Address Translation.
  • Good understanding of the TCP/IP stack and TCP/UDP operation.
  • Ability to diagnose the root cause of networking issues within complex network environments.
  • Ability to create and analyze packet captures to identify network and application issues.
  • Experience supporting Enterprise Firewall Platforms.
  • Experience configuring and troubleshooting IPSec VPNs.
  • Experience working with Network Management Systems utilizing SNMP & Syslog.
Preferred Skills:
  • Demonstrable understanding and experience supporting PIM Sparse Mode Multicast, Source Specific Multicast, and IGMPv2/v3.
  • Demonstrable understanding and experience supporting Network Time protocols – PTP, NTP, PPS.
  • Experience supporting the following platforms: Arista, Cisco Nexus, Cisco ASA, Fortigate, Palo Alto, Corvil.
  • Experience using Automation Technologies: Python, Ansible, Git.
Working Arrangements:
The working days for this role are Monday to Friday. The role holder will be expected to participate in a monthly shift rotation that consists of working a full-shift on one Saturday and on-call cover for the immediately following Sunday.
This is an office-based position, but occasional travel may be required by the business as part of this role.

++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++

Job #2-Team Lead Service Desk
**NO C2C or Visas-Full-Time/Perm Job. **NO Interns/Trainees Please.

The "Level 1 " Team Lead role is responsible for managing the operation of the "Level 1 " team (formerly known as "Service Desk”). This role is pivotal to providing professional and efficient "Level 1 " support. A key responsibility is to ensure that customer requirements are met in terms of communication, prioritization, and escalations.
A strong customer service mindset is crucial to succeeding in this role.
The Lead person will be hands on and will assist with standardizing "Level 1 " procedures and tools as well as making recommendations when discovering any inefficiencies. The Level 1 Service Operations Team are the 1st Point-of-Contact for all clients, providers and vendors service requests, service and maintenance alerts via Client's XXX technical Global Support Hotline, Ticketing System, email, or chat.

The "Level 1 " Team Lead will provide guidance, support, and motivation to the team members.
Oversee the activities of the team, delegate, and coordinate tasks to ensure client satisfaction and establish Level 1 team members objectives, monitor, evaluate performance and accountability in 24x7 Follow-The-Sun model.
Develop a timeline to complete projects and have the team members deliver within those timelines.
Produce and / or review KPIs, train the team members and motivate them to perform at their best.
The ideal candidate would have a demonstrated interest in Technology and Finance and prior experience leading a "Level 1” Team (or Service Desk).

Responsibilities and duties (include but not limited to):
Manage the day-to-day activities for the team, produce Key Performance Indicators (KPIs), propose/take corrective actions when the KPIs deviate from the expected outcome.
Develop a timeline to complete projects, publish project status updates.
Train the team members, ensure their knowledge is current.
Deliver and help the team deliver an outstanding level of service to our Customer base.
Display integrity and honesty.
Help monitor Client's XXX various monitoring and alerting systems, monitor the Service Operation's email and respond to the Service Operation hotline.
Help record all issues using our in-house ticketing system.
Provide and help the team provide first level problem determination/triage on all issues (network/systems/application) following simple run books. Provide guidance to the team members on such activities.
Help engage the relevant Subject Matter Experts and other Service Operation personnel, so they see the issue through to successful resolution.
Interface with client, vendors, market participants, and financial exchanges.
Channel formal communications to clients.
Generate statistics on issues raised, resolved, time to resolution and other Key Performance Indicators.
Foster open communication between team members, peer team members, and managers to bring forward ideas on how they can collectively deliver a more effective service.
In the purpose of the role, work as part of a Global Team that provides 24x7 "Level 1” cover on a rotation basis.
Education, Skills & Background (incl. Education and Experience Requirements):
Computer Science / applicable degree, or equivalent work experience is Preferred.
Understanding of Financial Markets (Equity, Futures, Options) Preferred.
Self-starter with a drive to develop own skills and knowledge.
Basic understanding of Networking.
Have excellent communication, influencing and customer management skills.
Team player.
Attentive to details.

Working Arrangements:
This is an office-based position, though currently remote due to the COVID-19 pandemic. Though travel may be required from time to time, it is not expected to be regular or frequent. The position holder will be expected to work whatever hours are necessary for the performance of this role (recognizing that it involves multiple jurisdictions / geographies including but not limited to EMEA, USA and APAC).

The coverage is "Follow the Sun - 24x7” so the team works in shifts ( "early” shift 7.30am ET to 4.30pm ET and "late” shift is 11 am ET to 8pm ET with 1hr lunch). Also, there is a rotation for Saturday/Sunday coverage.

Best Wishes and Success,

description:
Full Job Description

We are looking for a Software Engineering Intern, Full Stack Development.

As a Software Engineering Intern, you will help Markitors fulfill its mission to connect small businesses with their customers.

In this role you’ll not only work on writing code for the Terkel Applications, but also participate in the brainstorming sessions with the team for choosing the best features to help improve Terkel, our knowledge platform. We are looking for someone who has the intuition to work in a collaborative environment. If you have the above-mentioned qualities with strong technical skills in Full Stack Web Development, please apply for this role.

This position requires an strong technical knowledge, a willingness to follow a well-defined process pioneered by our CEO, passion, energy, entrepreneurial spirit, and a commitment to the success of small businesses.

What’s a day-to-day look like? Here it is.

  • Create REST API endpoints for integration between client and back-end services.
  • Develop new features for the website using Angular front end, Node.js services with a focus on positive end-user experience.
  • Deploying code from GitHub to the cloud on Azure, leveraging different Azure services.
  • Create good quality extensible code, avoid code smell, and refactor existing code base to increase readability and performance.
  • Attend Agile – Scrum calls and brainstorm ideas during all the meetings to bring diversity on the table
  • Work directly with CEO and Product Managers to enhance existing features or to develop new features for Terkel
  • Follow coding discipline and collaborate with the tech team on GitHub to share tasks and to update the existing code.

Ready to help small businesses sustainably grow their companies? Here are the things that stand out on a resume when we evaluate candidates:

  • Bachelor’s or master’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Business, or other relevant fields
  • 3.5 GPA or above
  • Experience in full stack software development, cloud development and deployment, creating and using REST endpoints, and working with SQL
  • Experience with source code management using Git
  • Previous experience with web frameworks such as Angular, Node.js, Express etc.
  • Familiarity with styling using CSS, particularly the use of Bootstrap and Flexbox
  • Familiarity with Linux and knowledge of basic Linux commands
  • Solid understanding of good coding practices and willingness to learn and work with new technologies
  • Experience working with open-source libraries and reading online documentation
  • An eye for good visual design and ability to identify optimum user workflow
  • Consistently recognized for passion, energy, and for commitment to small businesses
  • Ensure timely and high-quality of delivery
  • Well versed with Agile and Scrum environments
  • Basic knowledge for Microsoft office and Google Docs and Slides
  • Quick learner with the ability to follow a well-defined process
  • “You Are Unique” – an alignment with our core values
  • Bonus points for experience with tools like Asana, Postman, FileZilla/WinSCP, Azure, GitHub, and MySQL Workbench

Markitors is a great place to grow your knowledge and expertise in a progressive field that is becoming increasingly more complex. We have received three “Best Place To Work” awards and appear on the first page of search results for the term “digital marketing company.”

This is a paid internship and 100% remote position, meaning 100% of work will be done remotely with 0% of work being done in person.

Our brand companies include Linde, STILL, Baoli and Dematic. Real work. The only person you'll be getting coffee for at KION North America is yourself. You'll be doing professional level work that will have a real impact on the business

This internship opportunity is geared toward individuals who can ideally commit a full-time work schedule during core business hours. Start date of the internship is targeted for August 2021.

Responsibilities for this Internship will span Information Technology as well as Cybersecurity.
In this position, the candidate will learn how our organization runs our Corporate IT function. This position will allow the intern to gain a DoD Secret clearance, so US Citizenship is required. Intern responsibilities may include:

  • Assist with laptop setup, software installations, and email configuration.

  • administration.
  • Provide assistance and management with Azure Active Directory administration.
  • Provide support for Cisco VoIP systems and phones.

  • Use ticketing system to respond to user requests, track workload, and maintenance accurate status of ongoing initiatives.

Full Job Description
POSITION OVERVIEW:
IT DESKTOP SUPPORT

Mass Markets is a rapidly growing, industry leading business process outsourcing and software development organization. As a high growth organization with an entrepreneurial culture we are committed to a high octane, fun and collaborative work environment. As a member of the Mass Markets team you will have a high degree of responsibility and autonomy giving you a singular opportunity to make a difference is the organizations shape, direction and growth.

  • :
POSITION RESPONSIBILITIES:
WHAT DOES AN IT DESKTOP SUPPORT DO?

This position provides basic technical onsite and remote support including diagnosis of user problems related to specific supported hardware, software, and networking services provided by the IT department. Reporting directly to the director of network engineering, this position serves as the first point of contact troubleshooting, technology training, and new technology needs and facilitates the next level of support personnel for issues he/she cannot individually resolve.

Problem recognition, research, isolation, resolution, and follow-up for all computers and software within the organization.
Install and configure new hardware, maintain existing hardware, and track hardware inventory in real-time.
Operating system and software installation and configuration and maintain an accurate software license tracking system in real-time.
Asset management - responsible for tracking desktop hardware and software inventory in real-time.
On-site support - participate in end-user support and problem management for all areas of the IT infrastructure.
Coordinate with supervisors to provide high-quality support for new systems, projects and upgrades.
Other duties as assigned.

CANDIDATE QUALIFICATIONS:
WONDER IF YOU ARE A GOOD FIT?

Qualified candidates will be willing to learn new programs, processes and technology. Candidates should be positive, driven and confident individuals that will represent the company and its customers professionally at all times. Experience in customer care, sales or contact center role is a plus. To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. The primary requirements of this position include but are not limited to the following:

Desktop Support or IT Help Desk experience
Proficiency researching and troubleshooting complex problems and errors
Demonstrated ability with basic networking, and telephony
Demonstrated ability to research, plan, document, and execute complex tasks/projects
Excellent written and oral communication skills
Excellent interpersonal and customer service skills
Excellent work ethic and dedication
Associate’s (or equivalent) degree in Computer Science or Information Technology from a technical school OR equivalent combination of education and experience
CompTIA (A+, Network +, Server+ and Security+ certifications and/or Microsoft Certified IT Professional (MCITP) are a plus but not required

COMPENSATION DETAILS:
WANT AN EMPLOYER THAT VALUES YOUR CONTRIBUTION?

We believe that hard work should pay off, so we make sure that our compensation and total rewards are competitive. Standard starting compensation is commensurate with experience. Regular reviews and raises are awarded based on tenure and performance, so our employees make more each year.

Employees earn paid time off as well as paid holidays and paid training opportunities. Regular daily, weekly and monthly incentives are part of the overall compensation our team members enjoy and include monetary incentive and prizes such as computers, tablets, phones, TV’s, trips, tickets, and even cars. In addition to our standard group benefits offering for full-time employees following 90-days of employment, all employees are eligible to opt for our MEC medical plan after only 30-days of employment. Benefits options and plans vary slightly by location.

JUST A FEW OF THE BENEFITS

Medical, Dental, and Vision Coverage Options
Paid Time-Off
Regular Raises
Work-at-Home Opportunities
Advancement Opportunity
Fun, Engaging Work Environment
Casual Dress Code
Cash and Prize Contests

SCHEDULE:
NEED A SCHEDULE THAT WORKS WITH YOUR LIFE?

We can offer a wide range of scheduling options for qualified candidates. There are multiple shifts and weekly work variations available to our team members. Please ask a Talent Acquisition Specialist about the different types of creative scheduling options that are available at your location. Whether you are a busy parent, student, or just want control of your work-life balance, flexible, customized scheduling is one of the perks of working at our organization.

PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS:
This job operates in a professional office environment. While performing the duties of this job, the employee will be largely sedentary and will be required to sit/stand for long periods while using a computer and telephone headset. The employee will be regularly required to operate a computer and other office equipment, including a phone, copier, and printer. The employee may occasionally be required to move about the office to accomplish tasks; reach in any direction; raise or lower objects, move objects from place to place, hold onto objects, and move or exert force up to forty (40) pounds.

CONDITIONS OF EMPLOYMENT:
Must be authorized to work in their country of residence (The United States or Canada)
Must be willing to submit up to a LEVEL II background and/or security investigation with a fingerprint. Job offers are contingent on background/security investigation results
Must be willing to submit to drug screening. Job offers are contingent on drug screening results.

Shape the landscape of autonomous driving.

Job Summary

The Safeguard IT Infrastructure & Operations team is focused on delivering efficient and effective technology solutions and leading technology for providing stable, secure, and supportable connectivity, data access, support, across all of Safeguard Medical. Responsibilities will be focused on understanding, administrating our Infrastructure and the operations and management of the same This includes working with our support partners to ensure solution projects, implementations and support of for end users are addressed in a timely expected manner per contract.

This internship will provide an excellent opportunity to:
Experience the Operational side of IT by working directly with team members to improve and keep stable our infrastructure
Learn basic Project Management and tracking skills
Explore the various facets of infrastructure administration and maintenance
Develop and enhance customer service skills
Gain global experience through direct engagement with team members around the globe to rollout technology solutions and capabilities

Essential Job Functions

Customer first perspective!

Direct end user engagement to identify needs and concerns

Participate in calls to understand customer needs and aide in the delivery of solutions to address those needs

Work closely with global Safeguard team members to address with day to day questions and requests

Assist with CSOC/CISO type efforts for continually monitoring and addressing IT Security and compliance needs

Participate in the ongoing efforts with the I&O team to bring next level help desk to all users

Assist with basic project coordination/project management via SmartSheet updating of I&O projects

Develop basic infrastructure management and design skills via planning sessions and implementations

Follow-up on deliverables and action items to ensure they are completed on time and with quality

Assist with management of Help Desk support tickets in a Duty Manager type role

Ability to learn new technologies and demonstrate tool capabilities to end users

Technical writing to diagram and document processes and translate technical deployment details into user steps

Key Objective and Deliverables

Assist in managing day to day ITSM tickets to ensure users are supported in a timely fashion
Produce end user communication and process documents to translate technical deployment details into step by step end user setup actions
Document IT Infrastructure diagrams for Networking and Systems improvements
Assist in the technical writing of KnowledgeBase article for repeated support efforts for End user consumption
Provide direct 1:1 or 1:few supports of users during technical capability enablement (MFA, Intune enrollment, MyApps launch, etc.)
Help to Coordinate all active Infrastructure projects for Networking currently in motion, updating Smartsheets as needed
Propose or share knowledge of new ideas for providing secure, stable, and supportable infrastructure
Assist with CISO/Security related efforts to better understand CyberSecurity in a company
Participate in the next gen Device Management improvements we will be implementing for MDM solutions

Qualifications

Currently enrolled in bachelor or graduate program
Pursuing major in computer science, information technology, computer engineering, business/IT systems management or other related fields
Active interest in people and desire solve problems.
Ability to speak and connect with both technical and business personnel around the globe
Experience and genuine interest in working with customers/end-users
Excellent verbal, written and interpersonal communication skills

Competencies

Demonstrates ownership and accountability; Demonstrates the ability to plan, execute, control, and deliver, communicate effectively both written and verbal, and lead and influence others effectively.

Self-starter willing to take on new challenges and find creative solutions

Excellent customer service skills

Physical Requirements

Performing the duties of this job regularly involves, long hours sitting, active participation on audio and video conferences and occasional early or late hours to accommodate global schedules and technology change windows

Mental Requirements

This position requires the ability to maintain an appropriate work pace, comprehend and follow instructions, exercise logic and reasoning, organize and prioritize, read and compose written communication, communicate verbally, problem solve, make decisions, analyze and interpret data, multi-task/re-direct, and experience numerous interruptions. This position requires the ability to maintain the highest standards of professional maturity and emotional intelligence even in difficult or stressful situations.

Other Requirements

Up to 25% travel, including international travel as necessary

Work Environment

The noise level in the work environment is usually quiet to moderate.

Full Job Description
We are seeking candidates to fill an IT Help Desk Intern position to support users company wide. Key responsibilities will include maintaining and supporting all printers, workstations while gaining exposure to servers. Additionally, this position will support onboarding and offboarding of all company personnel including equipment preparation, connectivity, remote setup, and system access. This position will require a dynamic professional that’s able to adapt and manage a wide range of technical responsibilities.

PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES • Assisting employee users with all IT-related issues and providing desktop support across a distributed workforce with multiple offices (remote support for those outside of NYC) • Setting up and closing all hardware and software IT requests for new/departing employees, including rolling out desktop or laptop, cell phone, desk phone, and personal scanners/other peripherals • Troubleshoot connectivity issues on wired, wireless, and mobile connections. • Correctly prioritizing and troubleshooting issues reported by users for timely resolution, escalating to management/outside vendors when required • Completing licensing, PC, and other hardware maintenance • Maintaining inventory for IT-related consumables • Assisting IT team with research and special projects • Create a positive, satisfying customer support experience. SKILLS - EXPERIENCE AND REQUIREMENTS A successful Information Systems Intern will have the following: • Local College student working towards a Bachelor's Degree or equivalent from four-year College or technical school, preferably in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Information Systems. • Ability to dedicate 20-40 hours per week.

  • Experience putting together computers from scratch. • Must have working knowledge of Windows OS and Office products (Word, Excel, etc) • Must have excellent communication and prioritization skills with an emphasis on customer service & satisfaction • An appetite to learn • Basic Windows Server administration experience, including Active Directory, DNS, DHCP, IIS, print servers a plus • Basic virtual machine administration experience (specifically VMWare) – configuring, resizing, deploying, decommissioning a plus • O365 and Azure administration experience a plus • Basic networking and firewall setup and maintenance experience a plus • Scripting experience with PowerShell / batch scripting, PERL, Python, etc. a plus • General “can do” attitude to undertake dynamic changes in workplace.

They are a Financial Services company in NY, NY looking for a Full Time Network Operations Engineer Employee (1) and a Team Lead Service Desk Employee (1). Understanding of Financial Markets (Equity, Futures, Options, etc). Also produce and review Key Performance Indicators (KPI's).

Tony Bruno – Sr. Staffing Specialist
201-962-3563 (Direct)
tonybruno@careerdevelopers.com

Job #1-Network Operations Engineer
**NO C2C or Visas-Full-Time/Perm Job. **NO Interns/Trainees Please.

Client Profile:
Our XXX company fuels the Global Capital Markets community through the provision of trading technology and analytics solutions. As financial industry experts at the center of markets and technology, we help our clients efficiently scale their business and quickly access markets, supporting them through the full trading lifecycle. We are a Global Company headquartered in New York, with nine offices across the globe.

Purpose of the Role:
The Network Operations Team is responsible for maintaining the operational stability of all aspects of the Client's XXX proprietary electronic trading network, The Client XXX is a cutting edge, multi-vendor, multi-technology network that spans over forty locations globally.

Network Operations provide critical front-line support across many of the Client's XXX infrastructure technology domains, including, but not limited to:

Global and Regional WAN connectivity.
Metro Area Dark Fibre networks.
Ultra Low Latency Trading Fabric.
Edge connectivity to 200+ Financial Markets.
Data Center LAN networks in 40+ locations.
Market Data Feeds.
Bespoke client Trading environments.

Network Operations are a Global Team consisting of regional teams located in London, New York, Singapore, and Tokyo. The team operates a follow-the-sun model that provides dedicated network support 24 hours a day, 365 days a year.

This is a client facing role that demands a high standard of customer service and technical support be provided to both our internal and external clients.
Alongside normal daily activities, the role provides the opportunity to participate in project-based initiatives and collaboration with other technology teams.

Responsibilities and duties (include but are not limited to):
  • Diagnose the root cause of operational issues and provide suitable technical solutions for effective resolution.
  • Perform triage, troubleshooting, and fault resolution as part of Client's XXX Incident Management process.
  • Monitor the operational health of the network infrastructure using Event Management Systems and analysis tools.
  • Prepare and implement network changes in accordance with Client's XXX Change Management policy.
  • Work directly with clients to assist with support queries in alignment with Service Level Agreements, SLAs.
  • Identify opportunities within the environment to reduce inefficiencies, increase
operational stability, and enhance security.
  • Create and maintain technical documentation, including: infrastructure diagrams,
procedural run books, and knowledge base pages.
  • Adopt the use of the DevOps tool set to efficiently complete discovery and implementation tasks.
  • Manage client and internal case queues for all incident and project-based work.
  • Participate in Global Team collaboration efforts, including: shift handover, technical peer reviews, and knowledge transfers.
Education, Skills, and Background (including experience requirements):
  • 3 – 5 years of experience working in a large Enterprise or Service Provider environment.
  • Certified to CCNP level, or equivalent level of knowledge and experience.
  • Clear written and verbal communication skills.
  • Ability to prioritize and manage own workload.
  • Experience working within the Financial Industry Highly Preferred.
Required Skills:
  • Solid understanding of IPv4 addressing with the ability to subnet using VLSM.
  • Demonstrable understanding and experience supporting the following: o 802.1q VLANs and Trunks.
Multiple Spanning Tree Protocol.
o Etherchannel o Static Routing .
o OSPFv2 o BGPv4
o Routing protocol redistribution o Network Traffic Engineering using routing policies o Access Control Lists o Network Address Translation.
  • Good understanding of the TCP/IP stack and TCP/UDP operation.
  • Ability to diagnose the root cause of networking issues within complex network environments.
  • Ability to create and analyze packet captures to identify network and application issues.
  • Experience supporting Enterprise Firewall Platforms.
  • Experience configuring and troubleshooting IPSec VPNs.
  • Experience working with Network Management Systems utilizing SNMP & Syslog.
Preferred Skills:
  • Demonstrable understanding and experience supporting PIM Sparse Mode Multicast, Source Specific Multicast, and IGMPv2/v3.
  • Demonstrable understanding and experience supporting Network Time protocols – PTP, NTP, PPS.
  • Experience supporting the following platforms: Arista, Cisco Nexus, Cisco ASA, Fortigate, Palo Alto, Corvil.
  • Experience using Automation Technologies: Python, Ansible, Git.
Working Arrangements:
The working days for this role are Monday to Friday. The role holder will be expected to participate in a monthly shift rotation that consists of working a full-shift on one Saturday and on-call cover for the immediately following Sunday.
This is an office-based position, but occasional travel may be required by the business as part of this role.

++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++

Job #2-Team Lead Service Desk
**NO C2C or Visas-Full-Time/Perm Job. **NO Interns/Trainees Please.

The "Level 1 " Team Lead role is responsible for managing the operation of the "Level 1 " team (formerly known as "Service Desk”). The "Level 1 " Team Lead will provide guidance, support, and motivation to the team members.

Develop a timeline to complete projects and have the team members deliver within those timelines.
Produce and / or review KPIs, train the team members and motivate them to perform at their best.
The ideal candidate would have a demonstrated interest in Technology and Finance and prior experience leading a "Level 1” Team (or Service Desk).

Responsibilities and duties (include but not limited to):
Manage the day-to-day activities for the team, produce Key Performance Indicators (KPIs), propose/take corrective actions when the KPIs deviate from the expected outcome.
Develop a timeline to complete projects, publish project status updates.
Train the team members, ensure their knowledge is current.
Deliver and help the team deliver an outstanding level of service to our Customer base.
Display integrity and honesty.
Help monitor Client's XXX various monitoring and alerting systems, monitor the Service Operation's email and respond to the Service Operation hotline.
Help record all issues using our in-house ticketing system.
Provide and help the team provide first level problem determination/triage on all issues (network/systems/application) following simple run books. Provide guidance to the team members on such activities.
Help engage the relevant Subject Matter Experts and other Service Operation personnel, so they see the issue through to successful resolution.
Interface with client, vendors, market participants, and financial exchanges.
Channel formal communications to clients.
Generate statistics on issues raised, resolved, time to resolution and other Key Performance Indicators.
Foster open communication between team members, peer team members, and managers to bring forward ideas on how they can collectively deliver a more effective service.
In the purpose of the role, work as part of a Global Team that provides 24x7 "Level 1” cover on a rotation basis.
Education, Skills & Background (incl. Education and Experience Requirements):
Computer Science / applicable degree, or equivalent work experience is Preferred.
Understanding of Financial Markets (Equity, Futures, Options) Preferred.
Self-starter with a drive to develop own skills and knowledge.
Basic understanding of Networking.
Have excellent communication, influencing and customer management skills.
Team player.
Attentive to details.

Working Arrangements:
This is an office-based position, though currently remote due to the COVID-19 pandemic. Though travel may be required from time to time, it is not expected to be regular or frequent. position: RCIT Network Operations - Professional Student Intern (Paid)
description:
Full Job Description
JOB
The Riverside County Information Technology (RCIT) Department has an internship opportunity that will allow the incumbent to gain valuable experience on several components of the Enterprise Wide Area Network (WAN) and what it takes to maintain a reliable and secure Voice and Data Network. The selected candidate will have the opportunity to work with the Network Operations Staff on new customer projects as well as work alongside the Network Engineering Team .In addition to the minimum qualifications listed below, the most qualified candidates will have experience and knowledge of network products such as Juniper, VMWare, and Netgear. Candidates with CCENT, CCNA or CompTIA Network+ Certifications are strongly encouraged to apply. The RCIT Network Operations Internship is based out of Riverside and will be a combination of both remote and in-office work. The selected candidate can expect a flexible work week consisting of approximately 30-40 hours per week and requires a 2-year commitment.

EXAMPLE OF DUTIES
Monitor, coordinate and control network and remote access, and monitor network components,Work closely with awarded service providers on provisioning of new circuits.Troubleshooting problems on the network and measure network resource availability, performance, and capacity on a regularly scheduled basis.Install, configure, and maintain network hubs, switches, routers and access points.

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS
Cumulative Grade Point Average: Minimum 3.0 GPA required. Proof of most current unofficial/official transcript with cumulative GPA must be provided at time of application.Education: Applicants must be currently enrolled/attending school at an accredited college or university, in a Bachelor's or Master's program during the entire duration of the internship (2 years). All recent college graduates are eligible to intern for up to one year (twelve months) from their graduation date. Graduation date is not to exceed twelve month maximum during the entire duration of the internship (2 years). Areas of Study: Information Technology, Computer Science, or similar.Experience, Knowledge, Abilities: Self-Starter with the ability to work independently; Customer Service oriented; Must have advanced PC skills; Able to express technical terms to non-technical individuals.**All applicants, including alumni, are required to include a current resume and most recent unofficial/official transcript. Document(s) must be uploaded as attachments at time of application to be considered.**

SUPPLEMENTAL INFORMATION
Veteran's PreferenceThe County of Riverside has a Veteran's Preference Policy. Upload a copy of your (or your spouse's) Member-4 Form DD-214 or NGB-22 indicating dates of service, and a copy of your spouse's letter of disability (if applicable) with your application. For privacy reasons, it is recommended that you remove your social security information from the document(s). A Human Resources Representative will review the materials and determine if you qualify for Veteran's Preference. Policy is available here: https://www.rivcocob.org/wp-content/uploads/2018/07/C-3-Veterans-Preference-Program.pdfWhat's Next?This recruitment is open to all applicants currently enrolled/attending school at an accredited college or university or who have recently graduated within the past twelve months.No late applications will be permitted and changes or alterations cannot be accepted. Resumes that include job descriptions and duties copied from the job classification will not be considered.Applications received prior to the closing date will be considered based on the information submitted. Include relevant work experience details on resume and/or application. Applicants who fail to provide information demonstrating they possess the position requirements may not be considered further in the application process.General InformationFor more information, please contact lsilva@rivco.org

POSITION OVERVIEW:
IT DESKTOP SUPPORT

Mass Markets is a rapidly growing, industry leading business process outsourcing and software development organization. As a high growth organization with an entrepreneurial culture we are committed to a high octane, fun and collaborative work environment. As a member of the Mass Markets team you will have a high degree of responsibility and autonomy giving you a singular opportunity to make a difference is the organizations shape, direction and growth.

  • :
POSITION RESPONSIBILITIES:
WHAT DOES AN IT DESKTOP SUPPORT DO?

This position provides basic technical onsite and remote support including diagnosis of user problems related to specific supported hardware, software, and networking services provided by the IT department. Reporting directly to the director of network engineering, this position serves as the first point of contact troubleshooting, technology training, and new technology needs and facilitates the next level of support personnel for issues he/she cannot individually resolve.

Problem recognition, research, isolation, resolution, and follow-up for all computers and software within the organization.
Install and configure new hardware, maintain existing hardware, and track hardware inventory in real-time.
Operating system and software installation and configuration and maintain an accurate software license tracking system in real-time.
Asset management - responsible for tracking desktop hardware and software inventory in real-time.
On-site support - participate in end-user support and problem management for all areas of the IT infrastructure.
Coordinate with supervisors to provide high-quality support for new systems, projects and upgrades.
Other duties as assigned.

CANDIDATE QUALIFICATIONS:
WONDER IF YOU ARE A GOOD FIT?

Qualified candidates will be willing to learn new programs, processes and technology. Candidates should be positive, driven and confident individuals that will represent the company and its customers professionally at all times. Experience in customer care, sales or contact center role is a plus. To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. The primary requirements of this position include but are not limited to the following:

Desktop Support or IT Help Desk experience
Proficiency researching and troubleshooting complex problems and errors
Demonstrated ability with basic networking, and telephony
Demonstrated ability to research, plan, document, and execute complex tasks/projects
Excellent written and oral communication skills
Excellent interpersonal and customer service skills
Excellent work ethic and dedication
Associate’s (or equivalent) degree in Computer Science or Information Technology from a technical school OR equivalent combination of education and experience
CompTIA (A+, Network +, Server+ and Security+ certifications and/or Microsoft Certified IT Professional (MCITP) are a plus but not required

COMPENSATION DETAILS:
WANT AN EMPLOYER THAT VALUES YOUR CONTRIBUTION?

We believe that hard work should pay off, so we make sure that our compensation and total rewards are competitive. Standard starting compensation is commensurate with experience. Regular reviews and raises are awarded based on tenure and performance, so our employees make more each year.

Employees earn paid time off as well as paid holidays and paid training opportunities. Regular daily, weekly and monthly incentives are part of the overall compensation our team members enjoy and include monetary incentive and prizes such as computers, tablets, phones, TV’s, trips, tickets, and even cars. In addition to our standard group benefits offering for full-time employees following 90-days of employment, all employees are eligible to opt for our MEC medical plan after only 30-days of employment. Benefits options and plans vary slightly by location.

JUST A FEW OF THE BENEFITS

Medical, Dental, and Vision Coverage Options
Paid Time-Off
Regular Raises
Work-at-Home Opportunities
Advancement Opportunity
Fun, Engaging Work Environment
Casual Dress Code
Cash and Prize Contests

SCHEDULE:
NEED A SCHEDULE THAT WORKS WITH YOUR LIFE?

We can offer a wide range of scheduling options for qualified candidates. There are multiple shifts and weekly work variations available to our team members. Please ask a Talent Acquisition Specialist about the different types of creative scheduling options that are available at your location. Whether you are a busy parent, student, or just want control of your work-life balance, flexible, customized scheduling is one of the perks of working at our organization.

This job operates in a professional office environment. The employee will be regularly required to operate a computer and other office equipment, including a phone, copier, and printer. The employee may occasionally be required to move about the office to accomplish tasks; reach in any direction; raise or lower objects, move objects from place to place, hold onto objects, and move or exert force up to forty (40) pounds.

Collaborate with teams on development and implementation of service specific security practices
Work with independent software vendors to apply, test, and evaluate security and governance solutions for the cloud
Document findings from ISV collaborations and development of security practices
Build taxonomy of cloud security risks structured around a hierarchy of classes, subclasses, and elements
Participate in planning and execution of attack simulations on accounts and assets in AWS and Microsoft Azure

Demonstrated passion for cybersecurity and ability to think like a threat actor

Collaborative personality
Exceptional communication and interpersonal skills
Self-motivation and attention to detail

My name is Tony Bruno from Career Developers, and it's been awhile since we have reached out to you from our firm, but wanted to inform you about exciting positions we have for a growing client.

They are a Financial Services company in NY, NY looking for a Full Time Network Operations Engineer Employee (1) and a Team Lead Service Desk Employee (1). Understanding of Financial Markets (Equity, Futures, Options, etc). Also produce and review Key Performance Indicators (KPI's).

Tony Bruno – Sr. Staffing Specialist
201-962-3563 (Direct)
tonybruno@careerdevelopers.com

Job #1-Network Operations Engineer
**NO C2C or Visas-Full-Time/Perm Job. **NO Interns/Trainees Please.

Client Profile:
Our XXX company fuels the Global Capital Markets community through the provision of trading technology and analytics solutions. As financial industry experts at the center of markets and technology, we help our clients efficiently scale their business and quickly access markets, supporting them through the full trading lifecycle. We are a Global Company headquartered in New York, with nine offices across the globe.

Purpose of the Role:
The Network Operations Team is responsible for maintaining the operational stability of all aspects of the Client's XXX proprietary electronic trading network, The Client XXX is a cutting edge, multi-vendor, multi-technology network that spans over forty locations globally.

Network Operations provide critical front-line support across many of the Client's XXX infrastructure technology domains, including, but not limited to:

Global and Regional WAN connectivity.
Metro Area Dark Fibre networks.
Ultra Low Latency Trading Fabric.
Edge connectivity to 200+ Financial Markets.
Data Center LAN networks in 40+ locations.
Market Data Feeds.
Bespoke client Trading environments.

Network Operations are a Global Team consisting of regional teams located in London, New York, Singapore, and Tokyo. The team operates a follow-the-sun model that provides dedicated network support 24 hours a day, 365 days a year.

This is a client facing role that demands a high standard of customer service and technical support be provided to both our internal and external clients.
Alongside normal daily activities, the role provides the opportunity to participate in project-based initiatives and collaboration with other technology teams.

Responsibilities and duties (include but are not limited to):
  • Diagnose the root cause of operational issues and provide suitable technical solutions for effective resolution.
  • Perform triage, troubleshooting, and fault resolution as part of Client's XXX Incident Management process.
  • Monitor the operational health of the network infrastructure using Event Management Systems and analysis tools.
  • Prepare and implement network changes in accordance with Client's XXX Change Management policy.
  • Work directly with clients to assist with support queries in alignment with Service Level Agreements, SLAs.
  • Identify opportunities within the environment to reduce inefficiencies, increase
operational stability, and enhance security.
  • Create and maintain technical documentation, including: infrastructure diagrams,
procedural run books, and knowledge base pages.
  • Adopt the use of the DevOps tool set to efficiently complete discovery and implementation tasks.
  • Manage client and internal case queues for all incident and project-based work.
  • Participate in Global Team collaboration efforts, including: shift handover, technical peer reviews, and knowledge transfers.
Education, Skills, and Background (including experience requirements):
  • 3 – 5 years of experience working in a large Enterprise or Service Provider environment.
  • Certified to CCNP level, or equivalent level of knowledge and experience.
  • Clear written and verbal communication skills.
  • Ability to prioritize and manage own workload.
  • Experience working within the Financial Industry Highly Preferred.
Required Skills:
  • Solid understanding of IPv4 addressing with the ability to subnet using VLSM.
  • Demonstrable understanding and experience supporting the following: o 802.1q VLANs and Trunks.
Multiple Spanning Tree Protocol.
o Etherchannel o Static Routing .
o OSPFv2 o BGPv4
o Routing protocol redistribution o Network Traffic Engineering using routing policies o Access Control Lists o Network Address Translation.
  • Good understanding of the TCP/IP stack and TCP/UDP operation.
  • Ability to diagnose the root cause of networking issues within complex network environments.
  • Ability to create and analyze packet captures to identify network and application issues.
  • Experience supporting Enterprise Firewall Platforms.
  • Experience configuring and troubleshooting IPSec VPNs.
  • Experience working with Network Management Systems utilizing SNMP & Syslog.
Preferred Skills:
  • Demonstrable understanding and experience supporting PIM Sparse Mode Multicast, Source Specific Multicast, and IGMPv2/v3.
  • Demonstrable understanding and experience supporting Network Time protocols – PTP, NTP, PPS.
  • Experience supporting the following platforms: Arista, Cisco Nexus, Cisco ASA, Fortigate, Palo Alto, Corvil.
  • Experience using Automation Technologies: Python, Ansible, Git.
Working Arrangements:
The working days for this role are Monday to Friday. The role holder will be expected to participate in a monthly shift rotation that consists of working a full-shift on one Saturday and on-call cover for the immediately following Sunday.
This is an office-based position, but occasional travel may be required by the business as part of this role.

++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++

Job #2-Team Lead Service Desk
**NO C2C or Visas-Full-Time/Perm Job. **NO Interns/Trainees Please.

The "Level 1 " Team Lead role is responsible for managing the operation of the "Level 1 " team (formerly known as "Service Desk”). This role is pivotal to providing professional and efficient "Level 1 " support. A key responsibility is to ensure that customer requirements are met in terms of communication, prioritization, and escalations.
A strong customer service mindset is crucial to succeeding in this role.
The Lead person will be hands on and will assist with standardizing "Level 1 " procedures and tools as well as making recommendations when discovering any inefficiencies. The Level 1 Service Operations Team are the 1st Point-of-Contact for all clients, providers and vendors service requests, service and maintenance alerts via Client's XXX technical Global Support Hotline, Ticketing System, email, or chat.

The "Level 1 " Team Lead will provide guidance, support, and motivation to the team members.
Oversee the activities of the team, delegate, and coordinate tasks to ensure client satisfaction and establish Level 1 team members objectives, monitor, evaluate performance and accountability in 24x7 Follow-The-Sun model.
Develop a timeline to complete projects and have the team members deliver within those timelines.
Produce and / or review KPIs, train the team members and motivate them to perform at their best.
The ideal candidate would have a demonstrated interest in Technology and Finance and prior experience leading a "Level 1” Team (or Service Desk).

Responsibilities and duties (include but not limited to):
Manage the day-to-day activities for the team, produce Key Performance Indicators (KPIs), propose/take corrective actions when the KPIs deviate from the expected outcome.
Develop a timeline to complete projects, publish project status updates.
Train the team members, ensure their knowledge is current.
Deliver and help the team deliver an outstanding level of service to our Customer base.
Display integrity and honesty.
Help monitor Client's XXX various monitoring and alerting systems, monitor the Service Operation's email and respond to the Service Operation hotline.
Help record all issues using our in-house ticketing system.
Provide and help the team provide first level problem determination/triage on all issues (network/systems/application) following simple run books. Provide guidance to the team members on such activities.
Help engage the relevant Subject Matter Experts and other Service Operation personnel, so they see the issue through to successful resolution.
Interface with client, vendors, market participants, and financial exchanges.
Channel formal communications to clients.
Generate statistics on issues raised, resolved, time to resolution and other Key Performance Indicators.
Foster open communication between team members, peer team members, and managers to bring forward ideas on how they can collectively deliver a more effective service.
In the purpose of the role, work as part of a Global Team that provides 24x7 "Level 1” cover on a rotation basis.
Education, Skills & Background (incl. Education and Experience Requirements):
Computer Science / applicable degree, or equivalent work experience is Preferred.
Understanding of Financial Markets (Equity, Futures, Options) Preferred.
Self-starter with a drive to develop own skills and knowledge.
Basic understanding of Networking.
Have excellent communication, influencing and customer management skills.
Team player.
Attentive to details.

Working Arrangements:
This is an office-based position, though currently remote due to the COVID-19 pandemic. Though travel may be required from time to time, it is not expected to be regular or frequent. The position holder will be expected to work whatever hours are necessary for the performance of this role (recognizing that it involves multiple jurisdictions / geographies including but not limited to EMEA, USA and APAC).

The coverage is "Follow the Sun - 24x7” so the team works in shifts ( "early” shift 7.30am ET to 4.30pm ET and "late” shift is 11 am ET to 8pm ET with 1hr lunch). Also, there is a rotation for Saturday/Sunday coverage.

Best Wishes and Success,
Tony Bruno – Sr. Staffing Specialist
201-962-3563 (Direct)
tonybruno@careerdevelopers.com

Career Developers Inc.
3000 N Ocean Drive, S. 5H
Riviera Beach, FL 33404

Specializing in Contract and Permanent hiring in Technology/Pharma/Accounting/Marketing
Link to our open jobs http://www.careerdevelopers.com

Full Job Description
Job Description

As an ALSAC intern, you will learn from experts who have helped us become one of America’s top healthcare charities while supporting the life-saving mission of St. Jude Children’s Research Hospital.

Our fall program offers a 10 week fully immersed experience. You will be assigned a day to day manager in your industry and our program manager will lead you with networking and professional development events.

Start Date: August 30, 2021

End Date: November 5, 2021

Hours: 20 hours a week (Monday-Friday)

Pay Rate: All ALSAC interns are paid. Pay rate is based on work location.

Work Location: Hybrid (Virtual and Headquarters Office in Memphis, TN)

Requirements:
A passion for our mission!

Must be actively enrolled in an accredited college or university and in good standing.

Must be comfortable with Zoom and Microsoft Office products including Word, Excel, and Power Point.

Ability to work in a team environment but also work strong independently.

Ability to be organized and detailed to balance several projects simultaneously.

Must be able to maintain confidentiality.

Must be 18 years of age or older.

Specific Internship Description and Preferred Skills:
The Infrastructure Strategy and Cloud team creates a cloud strategy that enables our product teams to build and deploy products and campaigns quickly and securely, supporting our mission to raise funds and awareness for St. Jude Children’s Research Hospital. The strategy includes policies, operational guidelines and building a common platform.

Responsibilities include:
Cloud center of excellence and cloud application onboarding in AWS

Projects/Task include:
Doing Infrastructure as code to deploy cloud resources such as VPC’s, EC2, S3 storage buckets, Lamba, policies, IAM roles, etc.

Governing cloud spend and architecture validation

Support cloud operations

Majors preferred: Computer science or management information systems

Experience working with: AWS, application development, business intelligence, DevOps

Application & Interview Process:
After you submit your application and if you meet requirements, you will be sent an email to complete a virtual video interview from HireVue. Your submission will be reviewed and if you are selected to move forward, you will be contacted for a Zoom interview with the hiring manger. Final candidates will be selected by August 20, 2021.

For more information, visit stjude.org/alsacintern

ALSAC is an equal employment opportunity employer.

ALSAC does not discriminate against any individual with regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, transgender status, disability, veteran status, genetic information or other protected status.

Full Job Description
Do you want to learn real-world development skills? Accelerated Information Systems is an award-winning provider of world-class enterprise content management solutions. Our mission is to solve business challenges through the use of technology, expert consulting, and customized software solutions.

This position is part-time virtual internship. Interns will be expected to dedicate 20 hours per week to this position. Training and assignments will be performed remotely. There is an opportunity for employment after the internship concludes.

Training Overview:
Complete Laserfiche training and relevant certifications.
Build solutions, such as workflows, using our software tools that would solve business needs and help business processes run more efficiently.
Build electronic forms and process diagrams to automate processes.
Assist in solving customer support cases.

Qualifications:
Pursuing Bachelor’s degree, ideally in a STEM field.
Ability to learn and understand software, hardware, networking, and database systems.
Experience with scripting, JavaScript, CSS, HTML, JQuery, or web development.
Knowledge of programming best practices.
Experience with Microsoft Excel.
Exceptional problem-solving, analytical, communication, and customer service skills.
Ability to learn quickly and adapt to changing environments.

Not Required, But Very Helpful:
Coursework in Computer Science, Programming, Engineering, or IT.
Knowledge of SQL.
Knowledge C# or Visual Basic.
Experience troubleshooting technical issues.

With this virtual internship you will receive real-world training and professional experience. This internship is not paid. At Accelerated, we strive to provide a collaborative, creative environment where each person feels encouraged to contribute to our processes, decisions, planning and culture. Our core business hours are 9 AM to 5 PM Eastern Time.

Full Job Description

Location: Eatontown, NJ POSITION SUMMARY: The Collaboration Intern supports the professional services engineering staff by ensuring required products are correctly shipped to customer locations and is ready for provisioning. Typically, the intern will provide physical installation of devices by installing cards in chassis and racking chassis & patch cables as directed. Interns will work closely with project managers and document all equipment installed as instructed by engineering. Familiarity with software development, scripting, API integrations is desired. This position reports to the Collab Manager ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES- MAY INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING: OTHER DUTIES MAY BE ASSIGNED.

  • Understand the full lifecycle of a project. How it starts to how it ends
  • Assist engineers in completing tasks needed for project completion
  • Gain a clear understanding of the core technologies of collaboration
  • Understand what documents are needed for project closeout
  • Learn about the different models of phones that are used with the solution
  • Eventually become comfortable enough to assist with moves, adds, and changes
  • Listen in on project calls, both internal and with client, to understand how the information needed for a project is attained
  • Review and understand a Statement of Work (SoW)

Minimum Education and Experience:

  • High school diploma or equivalent required
  • Bachelor’s Degree in IT related field or Senior Year in college with goal of attaining BA in IT related field
  • Proficient with MS Office suite of tools (Word, Excel, Visio)

Preferred Education and Experience:

  • Professional Appearance & Demeanor with Customers
  • Prefer GPA of 3.0 or higher
  • MS-WORD, EXCEL
  • General Interest in Information Technology
  • Python Scripting/Programming

OTHER SKILLS and ABILITIES:

  • Good Interpersonal Skills (develop and maintain strong working relationships)
  • Strong work ethic
  • Good communication skills
  • Ability to multi-task as necessary
  • Ability to take what’s learned and apply to real world situations
  • Strong organizational skills
  • Good written and verbal communication skills with focus on customer satisfaction
  • Customer service skills
  • Proactive approach and good troubleshooting techniques

TRAVEL: Our client base is concentrated in NJ/NY/PA, but we do have clients up and down the Eastern Seaboard. Depending on your tasks, you may be required to go on-site. PHYSICAL DEMANDS: The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to sit and talk or hear. The employee frequently is required to stand; walk; and use hands to finger, handle, or feel objects, tools, or controls. The employee is occasionally required to reach with hands and arms. The employee must occasionally lift and/or move up to 50 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this job involve normal vision. WORK ENVIRONMENT: The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. The noise level in the work environment is usually quiet to moderate.

Job Type: Internship

Full Job Description
SRC, Inc. is currently seeking fall 2021 software engineering co-ops to design, develop and test leading-edge radar, communications technology, and more! From control graphical user interfaces (GUIs), high performance graphic displays, and mapping tools, to real-time software, low-level programming for embedded processors, driver development, and customization/optimization of operating systems, we offer a wide range of software development opportunities on fielded and prototype systems. We are looking for engineers to be immediately integrated into design teams to solve difficult technical problems.

Responsibilities

Design, develop and maintain mission-critical software in support of national defense, environmental protection, and intelligence gathering products and systems
Participate in laboratory and field integration testing to validate software
Document and communicate proposed software solutions with integrated, cross-functional engineering teams
Stay up to date on state-of-the-art programming techniques and software technologies
Participate in software design and code reviews to ensure delivery of quality products and enhance skillsets
Create modeling and simulation tools for hardware products and systems
Contribute to research and development that fuels innovation and technological advancements

Position Requirements

Completion of two years of college and current enrollment in an academic program focused in computer science, computer engineering or software engineering
A minimum grade point average of 3.3. Most recent transcripts are required with application (unofficial transcripts are acceptable)
Experience programming in one or more of the following languages: C++, C#, Java, JavaScript, HTML, and CSS
Strong interpersonal and communication skills
Interest in real-time software development, digital communications, radar data processing, radar control (GUI), or high-performance graphic displays
Participation in system integration and field-testing activities is a plus

Location Syracuse, New York
Employment Type Intern/Co-Op
Experience Required 0-1 Year
Education Required High School Diploma/GED
Security Clearance Requirement Must meet eligibility requirements
Travel % 0

Full Job Description
We're looking for an IT Systems Intern to join Procore's Systems Administration and Engineering team. In this role, you'll acquire experience and skill in system automation, administration, and integration of applications, platforms, and tools including Okta, Workday, Azure, AWS, Google Suites, and much more.

As an IT Systems Intern , you'll partner with many teams across the IT org to configure and optimize various SaaS solutions. Use your critical thinking and strong analysis skills to drive the business forward. If you are highly motivated, thrive on big challenges, and approach your work with ownership, openness, and optimism—we'd love to hear from you!

This is a paid part-time position reporting into our Senior Director, IT Operations. This role is based in our Carpinteria, CA or Austin, TX office. We're looking for someone to join us immediately.

What you'll do:
Help research, plan, and implement integration between SaaS applications and platforms
Administration of various SaaS solutions including configuration changes
Assist in provisioning and deprovisioning of applications and application access
Assist senior level staff with administration, engineering, and operational tasks as needed

What we're looking for:
Currently enrolled in a 4-year Computer Science, Information Technology, Math or a related program.
Great attention to detail
Academic or professional experience working with SaaS applications, including configuration, provisioning, and integrations using APIs
Critical thinker with strong analytical skills who can thrive in a fast-paced environment
High degree of self motivation
Excellent verbal and written communication

About Us

Procore Technologies is building the software that builds the world. We provide cloud-based construction management software that helps clients more efficiently build skyscrapers, hospitals, retail centers, airports, housing complexes and more. At Procore, we have worked hard to create and maintain a culture where you can own your work and are encouraged and given resources to try new ideas. Check us out on Glassdoor to see what others are saying about working at Procore.

We are an equal opportunity employer and welcome builders of all backgrounds. We thrive in a diverse, dynamic and inclusive environment. We do not tolerate discrimination against employees on the basis of age, color, disability, gender, gender identity or expression, marital status, national origin, political affiliation, race, religion, sexual orientation, veteran status, or any other classification protected by law.
